data.title: Terrific Patty Melt and Fries
data.text: It was our first visit, went based on reviews.  I knew I was having the patty melt before I got there.  So that and a dog with meat sauce, cole slaw and fries.  All were delicious but the slaw was a bit too spicy for me.  Fries were especially tasty.  Beer selections were interesting and our selections were great.  Prices were less than expected.

data.title: Just one Great Lunch spot
data.text: Riley's has a unique hot dog and burger menu. They will fix them any way you want, but the fun is in trying there interesting choices. They have a meat sauce that is not quite chili but very good especially with the hotdog that is thick and has a snap when you bite into it. My friend had a gourmet burger that he loved. Needless to say we will be back. Facility was clean and had a rustic feel.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: The staff is friendly and helpful, the food is real good and offers a nice twist to a hot dog or hamburg. And the decor is artful.

data.title: Mmmmm!
data.text: We went for a quick Friday night bite - we'd been wanting to try the place for a while.  We kept it simple - classic burger, classic dog and fries.  Yum!  The fries reminded me of the fries up at Old Orchard Beach - hand cut, lots of crispy ones & they even had vinegar with which to douse them!  The burger and hot dog were great. Although the chili sauce was a bit sweet for my taste, I'd get it again.  And now I can't wait to go back and branch out to try other things.  The staff was great - they've done such a great job making the place inviting and comfortable.  There's a counter along the front window and we ate watching the world pass by.  Just one more thing - if you're going on a Tuesday or Wednesday, get there early because they close at 6 (which we discovered by showing up close to 7).

data.title: Great Burgers and Hot Dogs
data.text: Large selection of burgers and hot dogs. They also serve various craft beers. The place has a lot of local character. Funny hot dog and hamburger jokes are written in chalk on the walls. Definitely a place worth checking out.

data.title: great burger
data.text: burgers are worth the wait, if you can call ahead. burgers made fresh as you wait, lots of selections. haven't tried the sides yet

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: Riley's is a great place for burgers and fries.  Their service is friendly, quick and professional. The House Burger is hand formed, perfectly cooked, juicy with the right amount of toppings and served "hot off the grill".  The fries were crisp, hot, and cooked without salt (as I requested). Prices are reasonable.  If you're looking for a place that serves a really good burger, go to Riley's.

data.title: Fresh Food
data.text: Everything on the menu is delicious. I am vegetarian so I always go with the Quinoa Burger or the Salmon Burger. People who work there are always super nice. I always take out but the restaurant is always clean and bright.

data.title: Love the burgers and fries...hot dogs not so much. Will return often!
data.text:
I found Riley's on Tripadvisor while looking for another place. I'm happy I did. Located a couple of hundred feet from Main Street in a historic building, I liked the look and feel as soon as I walked in. The interior is welcoming and a bit eclectic. A row of stools along a counter provide a nice view of the street. Several tables for 2 and 4 are available and I've heard they have seating outside when it's warm enough. 
I went for a  House Burger, 1/3 pound, fresh and hand formed along with cajun fries cut on site. The burger was very well prepared and juicy to bite into. The fries were just the way I like them and accompanied by a great chipotle ranch dipping sauce (though you'll need more than one container). I look forward to trying their other burgers. Being a big hot dog fan, I got a classic to go...yellow mustard, onions and their meat sauce. I've never been a big fan of anyone's meat sauce and the same was true here. Not to say that others won't like it...it just not my thing. Also, the dogs have a casing which is also not my preference. So I probably won't have another hot dog here, but I look forward to many burgers, fries and beer in the future. This is a great spot run by great people...support them please!

data.title: Sometimes you just want a hot dog
data.text: Forgetting all the bad press that hot dogs have gotten for...well forever, sometimes you just need to enjoy all life has to offer. I returned back to my homeland, meaning my hometown of New Britain and that I also grew up down the street. Times were tougher back then, it's nice to see the city being revitalized and establishments like this bringing old buildings back to life. Used to be the Ink Blot as long as I could remember, couldn't even tell if it was in business. Riley's has transformed the inside with an industrial feel that looks great. I got a chili cheese dog; hot dog had a nice crisp bite, bun was sized appropriately to handle the chili which was like a sweet meat sauce. Salty Balls are brined potatoes that were creamy and starchy, great alternative to plain ole fries that you could get anywhere. Found the fries to be over fried actually. BBQ mac and cheese burger was juicy but expecting more  for 6.75. I'd come back and order two hot dogs if you want to leave satisfied; $4-5 each hot dog, fries and a drink (they serve beer!) Doing the math it's not the cheapest lunch for hot dogs, although their toppings are anything but simple. You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Mmmm Mmmm Goood!
data.text: A great place if you are looking for a unique spin on old favorites: hot dogs and burgers.  Always fresh and tasty.  So many varieties that you will be back.

data.title: Really good burger!
data.text: This restaurant has one of the best burgers that I've eaten in a while.  Probably a little better than 5 Guys.  Dogs and sides are good but a little pricey.  I would definitely choose this location over a chain like Red Robin or 5 Guys because it's locally owned and probably fresher.  It's nice that you can have a beer there as well.  Ownership was very polite and friendly and you could tell that the customers in the location were regulars.  I would definitely go back and have already told my friends.

data.title: Best Burger Around
data.text: Stopped in for the first time at lunch and had a terrific experience. I had the "Kielbasi" burger and it was fabulous. My wife's classic American burger was absolutely perfect. Great selection of sodas and beers too. Parking is available along the building and in the adjacent metered lot.

data.title: Wow - great hot dogs
data.text: Stopped in for lunch and was not disappointed. You order at the counter and they bring the food out to you. They have a wonderful selection of hot dogs and burgers. They are noted for their home dog but also tried the popper dog with jalapenos. They have taco dogs, Chicago dogs, Reuben dogs - well the list goes on. The salty balls were good but really liked the Cajun Fries that were crispy and very tasty. Will definitely go back. The place is small and seats probably only around 25 or so but there is off the street parking which is also a plus.

data.title: Yummmmmm!
data.text: Atmosphere is upbeat and can get a little loud, but not in a bad way based on the setting! Food is really delicious and the guys behind the counter were super friendly and knowledgeable. Not a lot of room to move while waiting in line to order and things can get a bit hectic but they kept everything moving (and somehow managed to get the orders right!) all with a great attitude. Absolutely can't wait to go back ~ although my waistline might beg to differ! Worth every calorie though! :-)

data.title: Best hot dogs
data.text: Riley's hot dogs and burgers are delicious! The many toppings offered on the menu add to the wonderful flavors.  The mac and cheese hot dog or burger are a must.  Their hand cut fries are definitely the best I've had.  The decor is casual and very pleasant.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: This is one of my favorite new places!  I've tried almost everything on the menu, and it's all good! Fresh cut fries, juicy burgers and cold beer to go with anything they serve.  Try the 'Salty Balls', salt brined golden potatoes-they melt in your mouth, and are a healthier alternative.  They also serve Avery's Soda, which had made right in New Britain for years! It's a cute place, and very nice owners!

data.title: Great Hot Dogs!!!!
data.text: Saw an article in the local newspaper.  Yes I still read the newspaper.  I figured I'd give it a try.  WOW was I surprised!  The two dogs I tried the House Dog and the Classic Dog were amazing.  The sauce was unique and the relish had a sweet hot after taste.  I also had some fresh cut fries, no catsup needed for these.  I will be back.  I wish they had longer hours so I could stop in more.

data.title: Great dogs & fries!
data.text: Riley's menu is awesome.  There are so many different kinds of hot dog combinations, and their fries are the best I've had anywhere. The service is quick and very friendly.  I highly recommend Rileys.

data.title: Had a great lunch with the kids!
data.text: Stopped in for some treats  me and the kids had a wonderful lunch.  I had a hot dog and a sausage burger Mmm!
